archdesc.runner: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, University of Virginia Library
did.unittitle:
Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files
1943-1945
did.physdesc: This collection consists of ca. 10,500 items.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Access restrictions may apply to specific student records under the terms of the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (F.E.R.P.A.).

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Papers of the President of the University of Virginia, Office Administrative Files, Accession #RG-2/1/2.541, Special Collections, University of Virginia Library, Charlottesville, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was transferred on 22 March 1954.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: These files constitute the major record series generated by the president of the University of Virginia. The records consist chiefly of correspondence, but also include reports, minutes, clippings, memoranda, and related papers concerning all areas of business of the president's office.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p:
SUB-SERIES I: General Files, 1943-1944 Boxes 1-12
SUB-SERIES II: General Files, 1945 Boxes 13-21

did.unittitle: Buildings and Grounds--Cafeteria and Dining Hall--Commons 1943-1944
Building Program--(general sites of future buildings discussed) 1943-1944
Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching 1943-1944
Commons (includes correspondence with the Navy concerning use of commons) 1943-1944
Dean Ferguson (correspondence re--curriculum reorganization and the acceleration of programs) 1943-1944

Dean Lewis (information re--V-12 program, repayment of Honor Loan Fund, reopening of fraternities with new rules--concerning women, absences from class, rushing, and appointment of policemen and night-watchmen) 1943-1944
Endowment--including Alumni Board of Trustees Records 1943-1944
Extension Division--General (P.O.W. correspondence school program; history of the extension division) 1943-1944
Fellowships and Endowments--William A. Smith Memorial 1943-1944
Founder's Day--speech--"Thomas Jefferson--in Memoriam," by C. A. Beard; portrait of Simon Bolivar presented 1943-1944
"G" Miscellaneous (Wilson Gee summarizes his ideas concerning the service of the U. of VA to the State of Virginia) 1943-1944
Research--Bureau of Population and Economic Research 1943-1944
Research--Institute for Research in the Social Sciences 1943-1944
Research--League of Virginia Counties--County Government Clinic 1943-1944
Alumni Office--Alumni Fund, Class Managers, Bulletin 1945
Biology--Blandy Farm (contains a history of the farm) 1945
Buildings and Grounds--Emergency Housing--Federal Public Housing 1945
Carnegie Corporation for the Advancement of Teaching--General Correspondence 1945
Carnegie Corporation for the Advancement of Teaching--Minutes of Meeting 1945
Conservation Commission (information re--new natural resources building to be built at U.Va. and to house the Forest Service and the Geological Survey) 1945
Dean Ferguson (reorganization of school since Military departed) 1945
English--Lyndon Kent School of English Literature 1945
Fellowships and Scholarships--William A. Smith Memorial Scholarships 1945
Foreign Affairs (material concerning opening of school of foreign affairs) 1945
General Education Board (discussion of desegregation of police force) 1945
Law Department (discussion of needs include library, housing, a Professor of International Law, Legal Medicine course) 1945
National Association of State Universities--Committee on Accrediting 1945
Research--Bureau of Population and Economic Research 1945
Research--Bureau of Population and Economic Research (Miscellaneous printed bulletins) 1945
Research--Institute for Research in the Social Sciences 1945
Southern Association of Colleges and Secondary Schools 1945
University in the War (letters from Alumni and State members) 1945
